caption.p: Various plant families and species containing berberine alkaloids, having the potential for antitrichomonal activity.

td.italic: A. chlorantha (Oliv.) Setten and Maas, A.pilosa (Exell) Setten and Maas, R. pilocarpa Loefgr., C. polycarpa, R. mucosa (Jacq.) Baill., X. macrocarpa, X. polycarpa (DC.) Oliv.
Berberis, Caulophyllum, Jeffersonia, Mahonia, Nandina, Sinopodophyllum

tr.td: B. aristata DC., B. aquifolium Pursh, B. heterophylla Juss. ex Poir., B. beaniana C.K. Schneid., B. asiatica Roxb., B. croatica Horvat, B. thunbergii DC., B. vulgaris L. , B. pseudumbellata R. Parker

td.italic: C. fenestratum Colebr., T. cordifolia (Willd.) Miers

tr.td: Argemone, Bocconia, Chelidonium, Corydalis, Eschscholzia, Glaucium, Hunnemannia, Macleaya, Papaver, and Sanguinaria

A. alba F. Lestib., A. Mexicana L. , A. hispidu, A. munita Durand and Hilg., B. frutescens L. , Chelidonium majus L. , Corydalis solida (L.) Clairv., Corydalis turtschaninovii Besser, E. californica Cham., G. corniculatum (L.) Rudolph, P. rhoeas L. ,
C. chinensis Franch., C. japonica (Thunb.) Makino, C. rhizome, H. Canadensis L. , X. simplicissima Marshall
